file_content.text: Yuun will meet you aboard your ship presently, sir.
Sergeant, our mission is complete.
Captain! Truly, your journey has been one of unrivaled heroism and accomplishment. Yuun stands in awe.
I would never have pulled it off without you and your squad, Sergeant.
I had plenty of help.
Havoc Squad could never have done this without you and your team, Sergeant.
We had plenty of help.
Yuun is honored simply to have had a part in these occurrences, sir.
Just another amazing success.
Your expertise is certainly without equal, sir.
Can we go now?
This journey is very nearly complete, sir.
Yuun must now guide this final piece into its place, thereby completing the whole. A moment, please.
It is done. The Umbra encrypter, returned to functionality. Vast knowledge of our enemies can now be uncovered with ease.
This could change the entire face of the war, Sergeant. You should be proud.
Well done.
This journey was merely part of Yuun's duty to the Republic, nothing more.
Any Imperial transmissions we can test it on?
Let's try it out!
Yuun apologizes, but only this test phrase regarding grain allocations was available. All other transmissions are highly classified.
This isn't exactly exciting.
Yuun assures you, sir, many of our comrades will be ecstatic to begin testing this work.
Yuun would ask a small favor of you now. Many preparations must be made before Yuun embarks on Havoc Squad's path.
Could you do Yuun the honor of formally delivering the Umbra encrypter to Colonel Fierros, Yuun's former superior?
I would be honored, Sergeant.
Of course.
It is Yuun who is honored by your indulgence, sir.
I only helped, Sergeant. You should be the one to turn this in.
This should be your honor.
Yuun's deeds are done, and many already know of them. Other tasks must take precedence now.
I'll run your errand for you if it gets us out of here faster.
This is ridiculous.
Yuun appreciates your assistance in this.
Once all preparations have been made, Yuun will meet with you aboard your ship, sir. Thus, will our new journey begin.
Yuun will meet you at Aurek Base upon the hunt's completion. Journey well.
The pirates' stronghold is in the Star of Coruscant, a crashed Republic superdreadnaught. Legions of cutthroats guard its approach.
The last Umbra component is there. Please, Captain--will you brave the guns of our enemies and finish this hunt at last?
I'll get the last component, no matter what the opposition.
Affirmative.
Your bravery is truly unsurpassed.
What's one more daring and impossible assault?
I've made it this far.
Yuun cannot express how much Yuun appreciates the many dangers you have faced in the walking of this path.
Aren't you going to help me out on this?
You're not coming, too?
Yuun regrets that Yuun cannot join in this last journey. Yuun's squad is shattered and must return to base.
While you acquire the last piece, Yuun will assemble the rest. Please meet with Yuun at Aurek Base when your hunt is complete. Journey safely, sir.
Captain! Thank you, your arrival is very fortuitous. These pirates seemed to come from nowhere.
But I see Corporal Sajin is not with you. What has happened, Captain?
The pirates hit Sajin's team before I arrived. There were no survivors.
Sajin's team was KIA.
Sajin's team was wiped out before I could get there. My condolences.
I'm sorry, but he's dead.
Yuun appreciates your kindness, sir. Their sacrifice will not be forgotten.
The pirates wiped the floor with Sajin and the others. No one survived.
They were slaughtered.
Yuun... sees.
Wait, you knew pirates were attacking, and you didn't call to warn us?
Silence, Private. The captain would surely have called if it had been the right action to take. Is that not so, Captain?
I did what was necessary to accomplish our objectives.
That's right.
Yuun does not follow your meaning, but this can be discussed later. Other concerns stand before us.
I tried to call, but it was no good, Sergeant.
[Lie] Uh, my holo didn't work.
Yuun understands. Signal transmission has been a great problem for Republic forces on Hoth.
The pirates couldn't know we were on to them.
I needed you to be the bait.
Captain... this is most disturbing. Yuun hopes you will not use Yuun in this manner in the future.
Captain. Thank you for your timely warning. Yuun fears to imagine what might have happened without your help.
We're soldiers; we look out for each other.
No problem.
Yuun is honored to share brotherhood with one like you.
It must be tough, losing Sajin and the others.
Sorry about your losses.
Yes. But death is merely the final path of all beings. Dwelling on it only wastes thought.
I thought you could predict the future, Yuun. You shouldn't have needed my warning.
Didn't see this one coming?
It is true. Yuun has had little time to meditate on the signs recently. This has cost us most dearly.
The pirates' interest in the Umbra encrypter is troubling. Yuun had thought only the Republic would seek this knowledge.
I found something, sir--it's a recording one of the pirates was carrying. Let's see here--
--got a chance at serious credits on this one. If you fail me in this, I'll hang your hides on my walls!
Leave no witnesses. Grab the Umbra parts at these coordinates, and don't come back to the Star of Coruscant without them--got it?
How did pirates learn about the Umbra?
It is a perplexing mystery, but we have no time to meditate on its meaning.
What's the Star of Coruscant?
An old Republic superdreadnaught, lying broken upon Hoth's surface. It is the pirates' stronghold, guarded by an army of murderers and thieves.
Let's hunt this scum down and take her out.
The last Umbra component is surely in her possession. The only path is confrontation.
Only two more Umbra components are needed to complete the reconstruction. Signs lead to two caves within this region.
To speed our hunt's conclusion, Corporal Sajin has led part of Yuun's team to search the first of these caves, near your current position. Could you assist him?
I'll meet up with Corporal Sajin right away.
Affirmative.
Thank you very much, Captain.
Sure, Yuun. I'll keep your kids out of trouble.
Babysitting, huh?
Yuun has no offspring. Yuun's concern is for Corporal Sajin and his team.
Surely Corporal Sajin can handle a simple search op.
Can't he take care of himself?
Yuun does not doubt Sajin's ability to find the Umbra component. Yuun is concerned for Sajin's safety.
Premonitions of danger lurk in Yuun's mind. Perhaps our enemies closing in... please be cautious, sir.
I'll keep my eyes open, Sergeant.
Copy that.
There is no doubt in Yuun's mind that Havoc Squad can conquer any approaching threat.
Yuun will proceed to the second cave while you meet Sajin at the first. Please come and meet with Yuun once Sajin's work is done.
What have the signs shown you, Yuun?
Tell me what you've seen.
Hmm. Bloodthirst. Fury. Desperate desire for the Umbra components but limited understanding of the machine's purpose. And above all, fear of failure.
Of course you sense danger--we're in a war zone!
More useless mysticism.
This threat is more specific--something harries our path, seeking the same ends with a different purpose.
Yuun will meditate more on this while searching the second cave. Please meet Yuun there when Sajin's search is complete.
Journey well, sir.
Captain--Yuun congratulates you on your success against our enemies. No Imperial troops have interrupted the team.
Captain--the diversion has succeeded. Yuun's team has discovered much promising salvage.
Take your time, Sergeant, I'm keeping the Imps busy.
I'll hold here.
Yuun appreciates your noble risks on behalf of our hunt for knowledge.
This is the best time I've had in a while!
You're missing some fun!
Yuun is encouraged by your positivity.
Please contact Yuun from Senth Outpost nearby when your battle is complete. Holo signals transmit poorly in this area, and the transmitter there is much stronger. Yuun out.
I'm collapsing the cave and making my way out.
Time to go. [Detonate charges]
Yuun is pleased that the detonators are of assistance.
Please contact Yuun from Senth Outpost nearby once you've escaped--signals are poor here, and the holotransmitter there is much stronger. Yuun out.
Journey safely, Captain.
Yuun has meditated on the recovered data and determined the wrecks likely to bear Umbra encrypter parts. But Yuun also discovered this:
Outpost Four-two-seven, this is Major Artano, information control specialist for General Rakton's command group.
Republic personnel are searching Imperial shipwrecks on Hoth. This cannot continue. Full security details will be posted at all crash sites immediately.
I am en route to Hoth now. Any questions about General Rakton's orders may be addressed to me upon arrival. Glory to the Empire!
Might be harder to get those Umbra pieces, now.
Sounds like trouble.
Who's this General Rakton?
General Rakton?
General Rakton. Commander of forward assault operations, Imperial military forces. Believed responsible for all major campaigns in Republic space.
Rakton? He's Republic enemy number one--the man who plans and leads all of the Empire's major campaigns against us.
General Rakton is the Empire's top field commander and campaign planner. Supposedly, he's never been beaten.
Rakton? He's that big-time Imp general, right? The one they claim never lost so much as a school brawl?
Yuun knows only rumors. Rakton is said to be the Empire's marshal, guiding their soldiers' many belligerent works against the Republic.
What do we do now, sir? The Empire knows we're coming!
If the Empire puts up guards, then we fight through them, soldier.
We deal with it.
Yes, sir, Captain, sir.
Pull yourself together!
Apologies, sir. It won't happen again.
Care to divine a magical solution for us, Sergeant?
Your problem, Yuun--fix it.
We've drawn the Empire's full attention now. Great work.
This is your fault, Yuun.
Yuun believes we can turn this situation to our advantage. Many sites to be guarded have no Umbra components at all.
If Havoc Squad attacks one of these useless sites, guards would be drawn away from the others, allowing Yuun's squad to acquire Umbra components elsewhere.
Just pick a crash site and we'll move out.
Nice thinking.
Guess there's no other choice.
This path may be difficult, but Yuun is certain that the final result will be worthwhile.
Getting shot at to cover your moves isn't my idea of a good time.
I don't like playing decoy.
Best plan we're going to get, sir. And Havoc can take the heat.
Yuun regrets this, but Havoc Squad can face the danger far better than Yuun's team.
A nearby cave is guarded by the Empire. Assaulting it should draw much attention from our enemies.
Here, Captain--please take these detonators. If the Imperial reinforcements become too much, you can collapse the cave and escape.
Let's make it happen, Sergeant.
Sounds good.
I'll be fine.
Yuun is confident that Havoc Squad can surpass any enemy or barrier.
I never back down from a fight, Yuun.
I'm not a coward.
Yuun would never doubt the courage of Havoc Squad's famed leader.
Yuun's team will finish reloading and depart immediately. Journey safely, Captain.
That was incredible. I can't believe we pulled it off!
All ends can be reached if the proper path is followed, Sajin. One need only be wise and shrewd enough to see it.
You and your team should be very proud of your performance, Sergeant.
Good work, everyone.
Yuun is honored by your praise, Captain. With Havoc Squad's help, we have walked a path that we never could have walked.
What were you able to learn from the database, Sergeant?
Let's save the chat for later.
My team did all of the hard work.
Forgetting Havoc Squad's help?
I did all of the hard work.
Forgetting my help already?
Yuun's team was fortunate to have your assistance, Captain. Your help opened a path that would not otherwise have been available.
Captain. Yuun wishes to thank you for protecting the lives of Yuun's team, but also to warn you.
Turrets defend the halls you approach. A powerful force field lies beyond them, impassable and impenetrable to weapons.
The force field cannot be disabled remotely, but its structure is familiar to Yuun. Nearby control panels may be accessed and connections severed to allow passage.
Flank and sabotage the turrets ahead--sounds like a plan.
Copy that.
Yuun only wishes that more could be done to clear your path to the knowledge we seek.
I'm not sure how to disable a turret that way, Sergeant.
I'm not very technical.
Your concern is understood. Yuun will endeavor to provide assistance when called for.
First I have to bail you out, now you can't even disable turrets!
Are you any use at all?
Yuun apologizes for informing you of unpleasant truths.
Journey carefully, Captain.
Captain, please stand by. Yuun will remove the security door from your path momentarily.
I'll hold this position until you get the door open.
Copy that.
No obstacle stands long in the path of knowledge, Yuun assures you. The way will be open shortly.
Much obliged.
Yuun is pleased merely to apply skill in service of our greater cause. The way will be clear presently.
I don't like waiting.
Yuun apologizes. The way will be clear as soon as possible.
Captain, Yuun has discovered that an alarm has been raised, and troops are being summoned to the location of Yuun's team.
The Imperials' numbers are too great. Yuun's team will surely be slain unless Havoc Squad intercepts these enemies in their barracks.
I'll hit the barracks and stop the Imps immediately.
Understood.
Sounds like fun.
Yuun humbly thanks you for your help. Harmonious actions usher victory and truth ever closer.
Are you soldiers or not?
Yuun is shamed that this situation has occurred. Please accept Yuun's humblest apologies and thanks for your help.
Yuun's team requires some preparation. We will begin our infiltration presently.
The signs guide Yuun to the Crescent Canyon Facility nearby. It was built by Ortolan colonists but is now conquered by Imperials.
Imperial computers in the facility will contain locations of Imperial shipwrecks. Imperial shipwrecks will contain the Umbra components we seek. Do you follow?
Having the Imperials' own records should speed up our search.
Affirmative.
Searching the Imperials' computers can't hurt.
I guess so.
Yuun senses your hesitation. Experience no negativity--our search will assuredly yield great knowledge.
How do we know the Imps' computers actually have the info we need?
What are you basing this on?
The signs are many. As Yuun explained to Sajin, the smoke damage on the last component we discovered reveals the terrain we must tread.
The crescent pockmark indicates the Crescent Canyon Facility and the faded coolant halo symbolizes the knowledge to be gained there. Do you follow?
Let's assume you're right; what's your plan?
If you say so.
So, burn marks on a piece of metal are your clues?
Huh?
That is right! You understand very quickly. Yuun is a Findsman and follows these signs to quarry.
You want to base a military operation on this nonsense?
You're full of it.
Yuun is a Findsman. On Gand, Findsmen follow signs like these to locate their quarry, as Yuun does here. The quarry is never lost.
Imperial security in the Crescent Canyon Facility is very strong. There are many dangers and sealed doors within that must be bypassed.
Yuun's team will disable the security measures from the wings while Havoc Squad activates the Imperial database. Is this agreeable?
Havoc is used to going in first. Just point us in the right direction.
Affirmative, Sergeant.
Let's see where this crazy ride goes.
Sure, why not?
I decide who goes where, Sergeant.
I'll make the decisions here.
Unfortunately, disabling security will require Yuun's technical skills. If this is not done, the database cannot be reached.
Before infiltration begins, Yuun asks that Havoc Squad disable motion sensors which would alert the Imperials to our intentions. They are spread across the facility's perimeter.
Yuun will contact you when infiltration has begun. Please journey carefully, newfound friend.
Do you see here? Tracing the lines of the smoke damage, we see our path through the snows. Each piece shows signs leading us to the next.
That's amazing. I never would've imagined--officer on deck!
Captain! Yuun is pleased to make your honorable acquaintance, and to share this hunt for knowledge with one so renowned.
Why don't you give me the details of your operation, Sergeant?
At ease, everyone.
You're going to be part of my team soon, Sergeant. What do you think about that?
Ready to join Havoc?
This appointment gives such honor. Yuun can only hope to prove valuable during our search for the Umbra encrypter components.
The faster we get your work here done, the better.
Let's not waste time chatting.
Agreed. Speed is the essence of the hunt.
Hold up--am I really the only one who doesn't understand what freak-face here is saying?
Your sounds are difficult to reproduce without vocal chords. Is Gand no longer part of Special Forces language training?
Specialist Vik is new to SpecForce. He hasn't completed standard training yet.
No, it still is.
Great. Sorry I said anything--let's just get on with this.
As you wish.
Vik's a clever guy; he'll get the hang of it. Right, Vik?
I'm sure he'll pick it up.
Vik is here to blow stuff up, not to talk.
Ignore him.
Oh, this is going to be fun.
This is strange.
The Star of Coruscant?
Now we know the enemy's face.
Copy that.
I'm not very technical.
I don't like what I'm hearing.
